```{r}
encuesta <- read.csv2("Encuesta_habitos_dep.csv", 
                       encoding = "UTF-8",
                       dec = ".")
```

```{r}
#grafica de variable genero

par(bg="white")
plot(seq(0,3, length.out = 132), seq(0,132, length.out = 132), type="n",
     main   = "Género",
     
     font.main = 4,
     font.lab  = 4,
     cex.main  = 1.1,
     cex.lab   = 0.8,
     cex.sub   = 0.8,
     axes      = FALSE,
     xlab      = " ",
     ylab      = "Numero de personas que respondierón ",
     
     )

rect(par("usr")[1],par("usr")[3],par("usr")[2],par("usr")[4],col="white")

abline(h   = seq(0,132,10), 
       col = rep("grey30",17), 
       lty = 3,
       
       )

#guardar los datos de la columna en una tabla
tabla1 <- table(encuesta$genero)

#mostramos con barplot la tabla1
grafica1 <- barplot(tabla1,
                col       = c("blue", "yellow4"),
                font.axis = 2,
                axes      = FALSE,
                add       = TRUE
                )
axis(2, at = c(0,35,70,97,132),las = 1)

text(grafica1,
     c(45,105),
     labels = paste(tabla1," ó ",round((tabla1/sum(tabla1)*100),1),"%")
     )
```
